H0.text: Helicase opens two strands of DNA.

H1.text: Replication opens two strands of DNA.

H2.text: Adenylate is the molecule that opens two strands of DNA.

H3.text: Chromosomes are the structures that open two strands of DNA.

A4.text: Helicases are often used to separate strands of a DNA double helix or a self-annealed RNA molecule using the energy from ATP hydrolysis, a process characterized by the breaking of hydrogen bonds between annealed nucleotide bases.

A5.text: Helicases are motor proteins that move directionally along a nucleic double helix, separating the two hybridized nucleic acid strands (hence helic- + -ase), via the energy gained from ATP hydrolysis.
